articles.description: It raises a suggestion that higher levels of particle pollution could lead to higher rates of infection - for example in regions of northern Italy.
articles.content:
The new medical work is preliminary and it is not confirmed if the virus remains viable on pollution particles (Picture: Rex/ PA)
Coronavirus has been detected on particles of air pollution by scientists looking into whether the illness could be carried this… [+2081 chars]

articles.title: At least 7 coronavirus-related deaths in Cheshire West and Chester not captured in official data - Northwich Guardian
articles.description: AT LEAST seven deaths linked to coronavirus in Cheshire West and Chester may not be captured in official estimates, new figures suggest.
articles.content:
AT LEAST seven deaths linked to coronavirus in Cheshire West and Chester may not be captured in official estimates, new figures suggest.

articles.title: Coronavirus: US death toll passes 50,000 in world's deadliest outbreak - BBC News
articles.description: A grim milestone is passed by the world's deadliest outbreak, although US mortality rate is comparatively low.
articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty Images
The US virus death toll has surpassed 50,000, according to data from Johns Hopkins University, in what is the world's deadliest Covid-19 outbreak.
More than 3,000 deaths came in the last 24 hours, and there are now over 870,000 c… [+3928 chars]

articles.title: Driving to Craven to climb the Yorkshire Three Peaks 'is not essential travel' - North Yorkshire Police - Craven Herald
articles.description: WITH Craven expected to have good weather this weekend, police have stressed once again the importance of staying home.
articles.content:
WITH Craven expected to have good weather this weekend, police have stressed once again the importance of staying home.

articles.title: GPs should contact all shielded patients as a 'follow-up' to letter, says NHS - Pulse
articles.description: Practices should contact all of their patients who are shielding from coronavirus (Covid-19) as a 'follow-up' to the NHS letter notifying them to stay at home for 12 weeks, NHS England has said.
articles.content:
Practices should contact all of their patients who are shielding from coronavirus (Covid-19) as a 'follow-up' to the NHS letter notifying them to stay at home for 12 weeks, NHS England has said.
